intro: Iberis amara proles forestieri, commonly known as the Corsican candytuft, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, gray-green leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is typically found in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
